org.gearvrf.periodic

Interface GVRPeriodicEngine.PeriodicEvent

  • Enclosing class:
    GVRPeriodicEngine

    public static interface GVRPeriodicEngine.PeriodicEvent
    Represents a scheduled event. Returned by the methods that schedule a Runnable; allows you to query event status; cancel; and/or reschedule the event.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float UNSCHEDULED
      No execution is pending, either because this is a one-shot event that has already fired, or because this is a periodic event that has been canceled.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Cancel any future executions.
      float getCurrentWait()
      Seconds to (next) execution.
      int getRunCount()
      Number of times this event has run to completion.
      void runAfter(float delay)
      Reschedule, to run-once after a specified delay.
      void runEvery(float delay, float period)
      Reschedule, to run periodically and indefinitely.
      void runEvery(float delay, float period, GVRPeriodicEngine.KeepRunning callback)
      Reschedule, to run periodically with a callback.
      void runEvery(float delay, float period, int repetitions)
      Reschedule, to run periodically, for a set number of times.

    • Field Detail

      • UNSCHEDULED

        static final float UNSCHEDULED
        No execution is pending, either because this is a one-shot event that has already fired, or because this is a periodic event that has been canceled.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getRunCount

        int getRunCount()
        Number of times this event has run to completion. The count is guaranteed to be accurate within a GVRPeriodicEngine.KeepRunning callback.
        Returns:
        Number of times this event has run to completion.

      • getCurrentWait

        float getCurrentWait()
        Seconds to (next) execution. May be slightly negative, if execution is overdue; UNSCHEDULED indicates that no execution is pending, either because this is a one-shot event that has already fired, or because this is a periodic event that has been canceled.

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Cancel any future executions. If called from non-GL thread, there is a chance it will be called during an execution: this will not affect the current execution, but will cancel any future executions.

      • runAfter

        void runAfter(float delay)
        Reschedule, to run-once after a specified delay. You can call this on a run-once or a repeating event; it doesn't matter whether it is currently scheduled or it has already timed out. Calling this after a run-once event has run will make it run it again; calling this before a run-once event has run will change its scheduled time; calling this on a repeating event will turn it into a run-once event.
        Parameters:
        delay - The next execution will happen in delay seconds.

      • runEvery

        void runEvery(float delay,
              float period)
        Reschedule, to run periodically and indefinitely. You can call this on a run-once or a repeating event; it doesn't matter whether it is currently scheduled or it has already timed out. Calling this on a run-once event (before or after it has run) will turn it into a repeating event; calling this on a repeating event will change scheduling.
        Parameters:
        delay - The next execution will happen in delay seconds.
        period - Subsequent executions will happen every period seconds after the first rescheduled execution.

      • runEvery

        void runEvery(float delay,
              float period,
              int repetitions)
        Reschedule, to run periodically, for a set number of times. You can call this on a run-once or a repeating event; it doesn't matter whether it is currently scheduled or it has already timed out. Calling this on a run-once event (before or after it has run) will turn it into a repeating event; calling this on a repeating event will change scheduling.
        Parameters:
        delay - The next execution will happen in delay seconds.
        period - Subsequent executions will happen every period seconds after the first rescheduled execution.
        repetitions - Repeat count

      • runEvery

        void runEvery(float delay,
              float period,
              GVRPeriodicEngine.KeepRunning callback)
        Reschedule, to run periodically with a callback. You can call this on a run-once or a repeating event; it doesn't matter whether it is currently scheduled or it has already timed out. Calling this on a run-once event (before or after it has run) will turn it into a repeating event; calling this on a repeating event will change scheduling.
        Parameters:
        delay - The next execution will happen in delay seconds.
        period - Subsequent executions will happen every period seconds after the first rescheduled execution.
        callback - Callback that lets you cancel the task. null means run indefinitely.
